content.description: I think this is the most difficult route on the slab.  The crux is well protected at the 2nd bolt. The climbing is good and rewarding, with tricky moves and hidden holds. Characteristic of most lines here, easier terrain marks the upper half of this route, with the business being near the bottom.  While the routes here are all good, this one tends to be people's favorite.
content.protection: Four bolts to a shared chain anchor.

content.description:
This one move wonder route is the easiest lead on the slab.  Easy climbing leads to a very fun bulge and more easy climbing the rest of the way.  This route is just left of

Mantis

. A good warm-up, this line is a nice introduction to the wall. Fun climbing!

This is the next route left of

Attack on America

. A great route with a few puzzling moves. I remember doing some slippery mantling on this one. Consistent climbing the whole way.
content.protection: Six bolts to a shared anchor.

content.description:
The right most bolted route on the wall.  Precise foot work gets one past the smooth low angle crux, and on to steeper terrain with better holds. I have never found this route to be the most challenging on the wall.

Mantis

, despite its easier rating, seems to give the people I climb with more trouble.
content.protection:
Six bolts to a shared anchor with

Body Count

.
